column4: So, I wish Ubuntu 11.10 was Gnome-shell based, not unity. In order to use GNOME 3.2 shell what is the command to do so? Is it risk free?
you can choose during the login screen (lightdm) clicking in the engine next to the name
Muphrid Okay so I now know it's possible to use gnome-shell I just want to know IF I REPLACE Unity by gnome-shell, is it going to break my system?
no, they coexist peacefully, just choose between them during the login screen, in the worst case it will break only if you remove the unity package
